page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: Chartham is a large village lying by the side of the River Stour,which runs through a gap in the North Downs. The village is centered around the paper mill which has been a traditional industry in this area for many years.The village which is central in this grid has a hospital on it's eastern edge named after the man who brought the Catholic Church to Britain, St.Augustine. The area around Chartham is mainly agricultural,with a lot of sheep farming and orchards on the sides of the Downs. The Pilgrim's Way public footpath, passes through the grid from West to East on the route to Becket's shrine in Canterbury Cathedral.
